45#include <sys/stat.h>
46#if HAVE_ERR_H
47#include <err.h>
48#endif

51#include <fcntl.h>
52#endif

65struct pkg_meta {
66 char *meta_contents;
67 char *meta_comment;
68 char *meta_desc;
69 char *meta_mtree;
70 char *meta_build_version;
71 char *meta_build_info;
72 char *meta_size_pkg;
73 char *meta_size_all;
74 char *meta_required_by;
75 char *meta_display;
76 char *meta_install;
77 char *meta_deinstall;
78 char *meta_preserve;
79 char *meta_installed_info;
80};
81
82struct pkg_task {
83 char *pkgname;
84
85 const char *prefix;
86 char *install_prefix;
87
88 char *logdir;
89 char *install_logdir;
90 char *install_logdir_real;
91 char *other_version;
92
93 package_t plist;
94
95 struct pkg_meta meta_data;
96
97 struct archive *archive;
98 struct archive_entry *entry;
99
100 char *buildinfo[BI_ENUM_COUNT];
101
102 size_t dep_length, dep_allocated;
103 char **dependencies;
104};
105
106static const struct pkg_meta_desc {
107 size_t entry_offset;
108 const char *entry_filename;
109 int required_file;
110 mode_t perm;
111} pkg_meta_descriptors[] = {
112 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_contents), CONTENTS_FNAME, 1, 0644 },
113 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_comment), COMMENT_FNAME, 1, 0444},
114 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_desc), DESC_FNAME, 1, 0444},
115 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_install), INSTALL_FNAME, 0, 0555 },
116 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_deinstall), DEINSTALL_FNAME, 0, 0555 },
117 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_display), DISPLAY_FNAME, 0, 0444 },
118 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_mtree), MTREE_FNAME, 0, 0444 },
119 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_build_version), BUILD_VERSION_FNAME, 0, 0444 },
120 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_build_info), BUILD_INFO_FNAME, 0, 0444 },
121 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_size_pkg), SIZE_PKG_FNAME, 0, 0444 },
122 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_size_all), SIZE_ALL_FNAME, 0, 0444 },
123 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_preserve), PRESERVE_FNAME, 0, 0444 },
124 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_required_by), REQUIRED_BY_FNAME, 0, 0644 },
125 { offsetof(struct pkg_meta, meta_installed_info), INSTALLED_INFO_FNAME, 0, 0644 },
126 { 0, NULL, 0, 0 },
127};
128
129static int pkg_do(const char *, int, int);
130
131static int
132end_of_version(const char *opsys, const char *version_end)
133{
134 if (*version_end == '\0')
135 return 1;
136
137 if (strcmp(opsys, "NetBSD") == 0) {
138 if (strncmp(version_end, "_ALPHA", 6) == 0
139 || strncmp(version_end, "_BETA", 5) == 0
140 || strncmp(version_end, "_RC", 3) == 0
141 || strncmp(version_end, "_STABLE", 7) == 0
142 || strncmp(version_end, "_PATCH", 6) == 0)
143 return 1;
144 }
145
146 return 0;
147}
148
149static int
150compatible_platform(const char *opsys, const char *host, const char *package)
151{
152 int i = 0;
153
154 /* returns 1 if host and package operating system match */
155 if (strcmp(host, package) == 0)
156 return 1;
157
158 /* accept, if host version is a minor release of package version */
159 if (strncmp(host, package, strlen(package)) == 0)
160 return 1;
161
162 /* find offset of first difference */
163 for (i=0; (host[i] != '\0') && (host[i] == package[i]);)
164 i++;
165
166 if (end_of_version(opsys, host+i) && end_of_version(opsys, package+i))
167 return 1;
168
169 return 0;
170}
171
172static int
173mkdir_p(const char *path)
174{
175 char *p, *cur_end;
176 int done, saved_errno;
177 struct stat sb;
178
179 /*
180 * Handle the easy case of direct success or
181 * pre-existing directory first.
182 */
183 if (mkdir(path, 0777) == 0)
184 return 0;
185 if (stat(path, &sb) == 0) {
186 if (S_ISDIR(sb.st_mode))
187 return 0;
188 errno = ENOTDIR;
189 return -1;
190 }
191
192 cur_end = p = xstrdup(path);
193
194 for (;;) {
195 /*
196 * First skip leading slashes either from / or
197 * from the last iteration.
198 */
199 cur_end += strspn(cur_end, "/");
200 /* Find end of actual directory name. */
201 cur_end += strcspn(cur_end, "/");
202
203 /*
204 * Remember if this is the last component and
205 * overwrite / if needed.
206 */
207 done = (*cur_end == '\0');
208 *cur_end = '\0';
209
210 if (mkdir(p, 0777) == -1) {
211 saved_errno = errno;
212 if (stat(p, &sb) == 0) {
213 if (S_ISDIR(sb.st_mode))
214 goto pass;
215 errno = ENOTDIR;
216 } else {
217 errno = saved_errno;
218 }
219 free(p);
220 return -1;
221 }
222pass:
223 if (done)
224 break;
225 *cur_end = '/';
226 }
227
228 free(p);
229 return 0;
230}
231
232/*
233 * Read meta data from archive.
234 * Bail out if a required entry is missing or entries are in the wrong order.
235 */
236static int
237read_meta_data(struct pkg_task *pkg)
238{
239 const struct pkg_meta_desc *descr, *last_descr;
240 const char *fname;
241 char **target;
242 int64_t size;
243 int r, found_required;
244
245 found_required = 0;
246
247 r = ARCHIVE_OK;
248 last_descr = 0;
249
250 if (pkg->entry != NULL)
251 goto skip_header;
252
253 for (;;) {
254 r = archive_read_next_header(pkg->archive, &pkg->entry);
255 if (r != ARCHIVE_OK)
256 break;
257skip_header:
258 fname = archive_entry_pathname(pkg->entry);
259
260 for (descr = pkg_meta_descriptors; descr->entry_filename;
261 ++descr) {
262 if (strcmp(descr->entry_filename, fname) == 0)
263 break;
264 }
265 if (descr->entry_filename == NULL)
266 break;
267
268 if (descr->required_file)
269 ++found_required;
270
271 target = (char **)((char *)&pkg->meta_data +
272 descr->entry_offset);
273 if (*target) {
274 warnx("duplicate entry, package corrupt");
275 return -1;
276 }
277 if (descr < last_descr) {
278 warnx("misordered package");
279 return -1;
280 }
281 last_descr = descr;
282
283 size = archive_entry_size(pkg->entry);
284 if (size > SSIZE_MAX - 1) {
285 warnx("package meta data too large to process");
286 return -1;
287 }
288 *target = xmalloc(size + 1);
289 if (archive_read_data(pkg->archive, *target, size) != size) {
290 warnx("cannot read package meta data");
291 return -1;
292 }
293 (*target)[size] = '\0';
294 }
295
296 if (r != ARCHIVE_OK)
297 pkg->entry = NULL;
298 if (r == ARCHIVE_EOF)
299 r = ARCHIVE_OK;
300
301 for (descr = pkg_meta_descriptors; descr->entry_filename; ++descr) {
302 if (descr->required_file)
303 --found_required;
304 }
305
306 return !found_required && r == ARCHIVE_OK ? 0 : -1;
307}
308
309/*
310 * Free meta data.
311 */
312static void
313free_meta_data(struct pkg_task *pkg)
314{
315 const struct pkg_meta_desc *descr;
316 char **target;
317
318 for (descr = pkg_meta_descriptors; descr->entry_filename; ++descr) {
319 target = (char **)((char *)&pkg->meta_data +
320 descr->entry_offset);
321 free(*target);
322 *target = NULL;
323 }
324}
325
326/*
327 * Parse PLIST and populate pkg.
328 */
329static int
330pkg_parse_plist(struct pkg_task *pkg)
331{
332 plist_t *p;
333
334 parse_plist(&pkg->plist, pkg->meta_data.meta_contents);
335 if ((p = find_plist(&pkg->plist, PLIST_NAME)) == NULL) {
336 warnx("Invalid PLIST: missing @name");
337 return -1;
338 }
339 if (pkg->pkgname == NULL)
340 pkg->pkgname = xstrdup(p->name);
341 else if (strcmp(pkg->pkgname, p->name) != 0) {
342 warnx("Signature and PLIST differ on package name");
343 return -1;
344 }
345 if ((p = find_plist(&pkg->plist, PLIST_CWD)) == NULL) {
346 warnx("Invalid PLIST: missing @cwd");
347 return -1;
348 }
349
350 if (Prefix != NULL &&
351 strcmp(p->name, Prefix) != 0) {
352 size_t len;
353
354 delete_plist(&pkg->plist, FALSE, PLIST_CWD, NULL);
355 add_plist_top(&pkg->plist, PLIST_CWD, Prefix);
356 free(pkg->meta_data.meta_contents);
357 stringify_plist(&pkg->plist, &pkg->meta_data.meta_contents, &len,
358 Prefix);
359 pkg->prefix = Prefix;
360 } else
361 pkg->prefix = p->name;
362
363 if (Destdir != NULL)
364 pkg->install_prefix = xasprintf("%s/%s", Destdir, pkg->prefix);
365 else
366 pkg->install_prefix = xstrdup(pkg->prefix);
367
368 return 0;
369}
370
371/*
372 * Helper function to extract value from a string of the
373 * form key=value ending at eol.
374 */
375static char *
376dup_value(const char *line, const char *eol)
377{
378 const char *key;
379 char *val;
380
381 key = strchr(line, '=');
382 val = xmalloc(eol - key);
383 memcpy(val, key + 1, eol - key - 1);
384 val[eol - key - 1] = '\0';
385 return val;
386}
387
388static int
389check_already_installed(struct pkg_task *pkg)
390{
391 char *filename;
392 int fd;
393
394 filename = pkgdb_pkg_file(pkg->pkgname, CONTENTS_FNAME);
395 fd = open(filename, O_RDONLY);
396 free(filename);
397 if (fd == -1)
398 return 1;
399 close(fd);
400
401 if (ReplaceSame) {
402 struct stat sb;
403
404 pkg->install_logdir_real = pkg->install_logdir;
405 pkg->install_logdir = xasprintf("%s.xxxxxx", pkg->install_logdir);
406 if (stat(pkg->install_logdir, &sb) == 0) {
407 warnx("package `%s' already has a temporary update "
408 "directory `%s', remove it manually",
409 pkg->pkgname, pkg->install_logdir);
410 return -1;
411 }
412 return 1;
413 }
414
415 /* We can only arrive here for explicitly requested packages. */
416 if (!Automatic && is_automatic_installed(pkg->pkgname)) {
417 if (Fake ||
418 mark_as_automatic_installed(pkg->pkgname, 0) == 0)
419 warnx("package `%s' was already installed as "
420 "dependency, now marked as installed "
421 "manually", pkg->pkgname);
422 } else {
423 warnx("package `%s' already recorded as installed",
424 pkg->pkgname);
425 }
426 return 0;
427
428}
429
430static int
431check_other_installed(struct pkg_task *pkg)
432{
433 FILE *f, *f_pkg;
434 size_t len;
435 char *pkgbase, *iter, *filename;
436 package_t plist;
437 plist_t *p;
438 int status;
439
440 if (pkg->install_logdir_real) {
441 pkg->other_version = xstrdup(pkg->pkgname);
442 return 0;
443 }
444
445 pkgbase = xstrdup(pkg->pkgname);
446
447 if ((iter = strrchr(pkgbase, '-')) == NULL) {
448 free(pkgbase);
449 warnx("Invalid package name %s", pkg->pkgname);
450 return -1;
451 }
452 *iter = '\0';
453 pkg->other_version = find_best_matching_installed_pkg(pkgbase);
454 free(pkgbase);
455 if (pkg->other_version == NULL)
456 return 0;
457
458 if (!Replace) {
459 /* XXX This is redundant to the implicit conflict check. */
460 warnx("A different version of %s is already installed: %s",
461 pkg->pkgname, pkg->other_version);
462 return -1;
463 }
464
465 filename = pkgdb_pkg_file(pkg->other_version, REQUIRED_BY_FNAME);
466 errno = 0;
467 f = fopen(filename, "r");
468 free(filename);
469 if (f == NULL) {
470 if (errno == ENOENT) {
471 /* No packages depend on this, so everything is well. */
472 return 0;
473 }
474 warnx("Can't open +REQUIRED_BY of %s", pkg->other_version);
475 return -1;
476 }
477
478 status = 0;
479
480 while ((iter = fgetln(f, &len)) != NULL) {
481 if (iter[len - 1] == '\n')
482 iter[len - 1] = '\0';
483 filename = pkgdb_pkg_file(iter, CONTENTS_FNAME);
484 if ((f_pkg = fopen(filename, "r")) == NULL) {
485 warnx("Can't open +CONTENTS of depending package %s",
486 iter);
487 fclose(f);
488 return -1;
489 }
490 read_plist(&plist, f_pkg);
491 fclose(f_pkg);
492 for (p = plist.head; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
493 if (p->type == PLIST_IGNORE) {
494 p = p->next;
495 continue;
496 } else if (p->type != PLIST_PKGDEP)
497 continue;
498 /*
499 * XXX This is stricter than necessary.
500 * XXX One pattern might be fulfilled by
501 * XXX a different package and still need this
502 * XXX one for a different pattern.
503 */
504 if (pkg_match(p->name, pkg->other_version) == 0)
505 continue;
506 if (pkg_match(p->name, pkg->pkgname) == 1)
507 continue; /* Both match, ok. */
508 warnx("Dependency of %s fulfilled by %s, but not by %s",
509 iter, pkg->other_version, pkg->pkgname);
510 if (!ForceDepending)
511 status = -1;
512 break;
513 }
514 free_plist(&plist);
515 }
516
517 fclose(f);
518
519 return status;
520}
521
522/*
523 * Read package build information from meta data.
524 */
525static int
526read_buildinfo(struct pkg_task *pkg)
527{
528 const char *data, *eol, *next_line;
529
530 data = pkg->meta_data.meta_build_info;
531
532 for (; data != NULL && *data != '\0'; data = next_line) {
533 if ((eol = strchr(data, '\n')) == NULL) {
534 eol = data + strlen(data);
535 next_line = eol;
536 } else
537 next_line = eol + 1;
538
539 if (strncmp(data, "OPSYS=", 6) == 0)
540 pkg->buildinfo[BI_OPSYS] = dup_value(data, eol);
541 else if (strncmp(data, "OS_VERSION=", 11) == 0)
542 pkg->buildinfo[BI_OS_VERSION] = dup_value(data, eol);
543 else if (strncmp(data, "MACHINE_ARCH=", 13) == 0)
544 pkg->buildinfo[BI_MACHINE_ARCH] = dup_value(data, eol);
545 else if (strncmp(data, "IGNORE_RECOMMENDED=", 19) == 0)
546 pkg->buildinfo[BI_IGNORE_RECOMMENDED] = dup_value(data,
547 eol);
548 else if (strncmp(data, "USE_ABI_DEPENDS=", 16) == 0)
549 pkg->buildinfo[BI_USE_ABI_DEPENDS] = dup_value(data,
550 eol);
551 else if (strncmp(data, "LICENSE=", 8) == 0)
552 pkg->buildinfo[BI_LICENSE] = dup_value(data, eol);
553 else if (strncmp(data, "PKGTOOLS_VERSION=", 17) == 0)
554 pkg->buildinfo[BI_PKGTOOLS_VERSION] = dup_value(data,
555 eol);
556 }
557 if (pkg->buildinfo[BI_OPSYS] == NULL ||
558 pkg->buildinfo[BI_OS_VERSION] == NULL ||
559 pkg->buildinfo[BI_MACHINE_ARCH] == NULL) {
560 warnx("Not all required build information are present.");
561 return -1;
562 }
563
564 if ((pkg->buildinfo[BI_USE_ABI_DEPENDS] != NULL &&
565 strcasecmp(pkg->buildinfo[BI_USE_ABI_DEPENDS], "YES") != 0) ||
566 (pkg->buildinfo[BI_IGNORE_RECOMMENDED] != NULL &&
567 strcasecmp(pkg->buildinfo[BI_IGNORE_RECOMMENDED], "NO") != 0)) {
568 warnx("%s was built to ignore ABI dependencies", pkg->pkgname);
569 }
570
571 return 0;
572}
573
574/*
575 * Free buildinfo.
576 */
577static void
578free_buildinfo(struct pkg_task *pkg)
579{
580 size_t i;
581
582 for (i = 0; i < BI_ENUM_COUNT; ++i) {
583 free(pkg->buildinfo[i]);
584 pkg->buildinfo[i] = NULL;
585 }
586}
587
588/*
589 * Write meta data files to pkgdb after creating the directory.
590 */
591static int
592write_meta_data(struct pkg_task *pkg)
593{
594 const struct pkg_meta_desc *descr;
595 char *filename, **target;
596 size_t len;
597 ssize_t ret;
598 int fd;
599
600 if (Fake)
601 return 0;
602
603 if (mkdir_p(pkg->install_logdir)) {
604 warn("Can't create pkgdb entry: %s", pkg->install_logdir);
605 return -1;
606 }
607
608 for (descr = pkg_meta_descriptors; descr->entry_filename; ++descr) {
609 target = (char **)((char *)&pkg->meta_data +
610 descr->entry_offset);
611 if (*target == NULL)
612 continue;
613 filename = xasprintf("%s/%s", pkg->install_logdir,
614 descr->entry_filename);
615 (void)unlink(filename);
616 fd = open(filename, O_WRONLY | O_TRUNC | O_CREAT, descr->perm);
617 if (fd == -1) {
618 warn("Can't open meta data file: %s", filename);
619 return -1;
620 }
621 len = strlen(*target);
622 do {
623 ret = write(fd, *target, len);
624 if (ret == -1) {
625 warn("Can't write meta data file: %s",
626 filename);
627 free(filename);
628 close(fd);
629 return -1;
630 }
631 len -= ret;
632 } while (ret > 0);
633 if (close(fd) == -1) {
634 warn("Can't close meta data file: %s", filename);
635 free(filename);
636 return -1;
637 }
638 free(filename);
639 }
640
641 return 0;
642}
643
644/*
645 * Helper function for extract_files.
646 */
647static int
648copy_data_to_disk(struct archive *reader, struct archive *writer,
649 const char *filename)
650{
651 int r;
652 const void *buff;
653 size_t size;
654 off_t offset;
655
656 for (;;) {
657 r = archive_read_data_block(reader, &buff, &size, &offset);
658 if (r == ARCHIVE_EOF)
659 return 0;
660 if (r != ARCHIVE_OK) {
661 warnx("Read error for %s: %s", filename,
662 archive_error_string(reader));
663 return -1;
664 }
665 r = archive_write_data_block(writer, buff, size, offset);
666 if (r != ARCHIVE_OK) {
667 warnx("Write error for %s: %s", filename,
668 archive_error_string(writer));
669 return -1;
670 }
671 }
672}
673
674/*
675 * Extract package.
676 * Any misordered, missing or unlisted file in the package is an error.
677 */
678
679static const int extract_flags = ARCHIVE_EXTRACT_OWNER |
680 ARCHIVE_EXTRACT_PERM | ARCHIVE_EXTRACT_TIME | ARCHIVE_EXTRACT_UNLINK |
681 ARCHIVE_EXTRACT_ACL | ARCHIVE_EXTRACT_FFLAGS | ARCHIVE_EXTRACT_XATTR;
682
683static int
684extract_files(struct pkg_task *pkg)
685{
686 char cmd[MaxPathSize];
687 const char *owner, *group, *permissions;
688 struct archive *writer;
689 int r;
690 plist_t *p;
691 const char *last_file;
692 char *fullpath;
693
694 if (Fake)
695 return 0;
696
697 if (mkdir_p(pkg->install_prefix)) {
698 warn("Can't create prefix: %s", pkg->install_prefix);
699 return -1;
700 }
701
702 if (!NoRecord && !pkgdb_open(ReadWrite)) {
703 warn("Can't open pkgdb for writing");
704 return -1;
705 }
706
707 if (chdir(pkg->install_prefix) == -1) {
708 warn("Can't change into prefix: %s", pkg->install_prefix);
709 return -1;
710 }
711
712 writer = archive_write_disk_new();
713 archive_write_disk_set_options(writer, extract_flags);
714 archive_write_disk_set_standard_lookup(writer);
715
716 owner = NULL;
717 group = NULL;
718 permissions = NULL;
719 last_file = NULL;
720
721 r = -1;
722
723 for (p = pkg->plist.head; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
724 switch (p->type) {
725 case PLIST_FILE:
726 last_file = p->name;
727 if (pkg->entry == NULL) {
728 warnx("PLIST entry not in package (%s)",
729 archive_entry_pathname(pkg->entry));
730 goto out;
731 }
732 if (strcmp(p->name, archive_entry_pathname(pkg->entry))) {
733 warnx("PLIST entry and package don't match (%s vs %s)",
734 p->name, archive_entry_pathname(pkg->entry));
735 goto out;
736 }
737 fullpath = xasprintf("%s/%s", pkg->prefix, p->name);
738 pkgdb_store(fullpath, pkg->pkgname);
739 free(fullpath);
740 if (Verbose)
741 printf("%s", p->name);
742 break;
743
744 case PLIST_PKGDIR:
745 fullpath = xasprintf("%s/%s", pkg->prefix, p->name);
746 mkdir_p(fullpath);
747 free(fullpath);
748 add_pkgdir(pkg->pkgname, pkg->prefix, p->name);
749 continue;
750
751 case PLIST_CMD:
752 if (format_cmd(cmd, sizeof(cmd), p->name, pkg->prefix, last_file))
753 return -1;
754 printf("Executing '%s'\n", cmd);
755 if (!Fake && system(cmd))
756 warnx("command '%s' failed", cmd); /* XXX bail out? */
757 continue;
758
759 case PLIST_CHMOD:
760 permissions = p->name;
761 continue;
762
763 case PLIST_CHOWN:
764 owner = p->name;
765 continue;
766
767 case PLIST_CHGRP:
768 group = p->name;
769 continue;
770
771 case PLIST_IGNORE:
772 p = p->next;
773 continue;
774
775 default:
776 continue;
777 }
778
779 r = archive_write_header(writer, pkg->entry);
780 if (r != ARCHIVE_OK) {
781 warnx("Failed to write %s for %s: %s",
782 archive_entry_pathname(pkg->entry),
783 pkg->pkgname,
784 archive_error_string(writer));
785 goto out;
786 }
787
788 if (owner != NULL)
789 archive_entry_set_uname(pkg->entry, owner);
790 if (group != NULL)
791 archive_entry_set_uname(pkg->entry, group);
792 if (permissions != NULL) {
793 mode_t mode;
794
795 mode = archive_entry_mode(pkg->entry);
796 mode = getmode(setmode(permissions), mode);
797 archive_entry_set_mode(pkg->entry, mode);
798 }
799
800 r = copy_data_to_disk(pkg->archive, writer,
801 archive_entry_pathname(pkg->entry));
802 if (r)
803 goto out;
804 if (Verbose)
805 printf("\n");
806
807 r = archive_read_next_header(pkg->archive, &pkg->entry);
808 if (r == ARCHIVE_EOF) {
809 pkg->entry = NULL;
810 continue;
811 }
812 if (r != ARCHIVE_OK) {
813 warnx("Failed to read from archive for %s: %s",
814 pkg->pkgname,
815 archive_error_string(pkg->archive));
816 goto out;
817 }
818 }
819
820 if (pkg->entry != NULL) {
821 warnx("Package contains entries not in PLIST: %s",
822 archive_entry_pathname(pkg->entry));
823 goto out;
824 }
825
826 r = 0;
827
828out:
829 if (!NoRecord)
830 pkgdb_close();
831 archive_write_free(writer);
832
833 return r;
834}
835
836/*
837 * Register dependencies after sucessfully installing the package.
838 */
839static void
840pkg_register_depends(struct pkg_task *pkg)
841{
842 int fd;
843 size_t text_len, i;
844 char *required_by, *text;
845
846 if (Fake)
847 return;
848
849 text = xasprintf("%s\n", pkg->pkgname);
850 text_len = strlen(text);
851
852 for (i = 0; i < pkg->dep_length; ++i) {
853 required_by = pkgdb_pkg_file(pkg->dependencies[i], REQUIRED_BY_FNAME);
854
855 fd = open(required_by, O_WRONLY | O_APPEND | O_CREAT, 0644);
856 if (fd == -1) {
857 warn("can't open dependency file '%s',"
858 "registration is incomplete!", required_by);
859 } else if (write(fd, text, text_len) != (ssize_t)text_len) {
860 warn("can't write to dependency file `%s'", required_by);
861 close(fd);
862 } else if (close(fd) == -1)
863 warn("cannot close file %s", required_by);
864
865 free(required_by);
866 }
867
868 free(text);
869}
870
871/*
872 * Reduce the result from uname(3) to a canonical form.
873 */
874static void
875normalise_platform(struct utsname *host_name)
876{
877#ifdef NUMERIC_VERSION_ONLY
878 size_t span;
879
880 span = strspn(host_name->release, "0123456789.");
881 host_name->release[span] = '\0';
882#endif
883}
884
885/*
886 * Check build platform of the package against local host.
887 */
888static int
889check_platform(struct pkg_task *pkg)
890{
891 struct utsname host_uname;
892 const char *effective_arch;
893 int fatal;
894
895 if (uname(&host_uname) < 0) {
896 if (Force) {
897 warnx("uname() failed, continuing.");
898 return 0;
899 } else {
900 warnx("uname() failed, aborting.");
901 return -1;
902 }
903 }
904
905 normalise_platform(&host_uname);
906
907 if (OverrideMachine != NULL)
908 effective_arch = OverrideMachine;
909 else
910 effective_arch = PKGSRC_MACHINE_ARCH;
911
912 /* If either the OS or arch are different, bomb */
913 if (strcmp(OPSYS_NAME, pkg->buildinfo[BI_OPSYS]) ||
914 strcmp(effective_arch, pkg->buildinfo[BI_MACHINE_ARCH]) != 0)
915 fatal = 1;
916 else
917 fatal = 0;
918
919 if (fatal ||
920 compatible_platform(OPSYS_NAME, host_uname.release,
921 pkg->buildinfo[BI_OS_VERSION]) != 1) {
922 warnx("Warning: package `%s' was built for a platform:",
923 pkg->pkgname);
924 warnx("%s/%s %s (pkg) vs. %s/%s %s (this host)",
925 pkg->buildinfo[BI_OPSYS],
926 pkg->buildinfo[BI_MACHINE_ARCH],
927 pkg->buildinfo[BI_OS_VERSION],
928 OPSYS_NAME,
929 effective_arch,
930 host_uname.release);
931 if (!Force && fatal)
932 return -1;
933 }
934 return 0;
935}
936
937static int
938check_pkgtools_version(struct pkg_task *pkg)
939{
940 const char *val = pkg->buildinfo[BI_PKGTOOLS_VERSION];
941 int version;
942
943 if (val == NULL) {
944 warnx("Warning: package `%s' lacks pkg_install version data",
945 pkg->pkgname);
946 return 0;
947 }
948
949 if (strlen(val) != 8 || strspn(val, "0123456789") != 8) {
950 warnx("Warning: package `%s' contains an invalid pkg_install version",
951 pkg->pkgname);
952 return Force ? 0 : -1;
953 }
954 version = atoi(val);
955 if (version > PKGTOOLS_VERSION) {
956 warnx("%s: package `%s' was built with a newer pkg_install version",
957 Force ? "Warning" : "Error", pkg->pkgname);
958 return Force ? 0 : -1;
959 }
960 return 0;
961}
962
963/*
964 * Run the install script.
965 */
966static int
967run_install_script(struct pkg_task *pkg, const char *argument)
968{
969 int ret;
970 char *filename;
971
972 if (pkg->meta_data.meta_install == NULL || NoInstall)
973 return 0;
974
975 if (Destdir != NULL)
976 setenv(PKG_DESTDIR_VNAME, Destdir, 1);
977 setenv(PKG_PREFIX_VNAME, pkg->prefix, 1);
978 setenv(PKG_METADATA_DIR_VNAME, pkg->logdir, 1);
979 setenv(PKG_REFCOUNT_DBDIR_VNAME, config_pkg_refcount_dbdir, 1);
980
981 if (Verbose)
982 printf("Running install with PRE-INSTALL for %s.\n", pkg->pkgname);
983 if (Fake)
984 return 0;
985
986 filename = pkgdb_pkg_file(pkg->pkgname, INSTALL_FNAME);
987
988 ret = 0;
989 errno = 0;
990 if (fcexec(pkg->install_logdir, filename, pkg->pkgname, argument,
991 (void *)NULL)) {
992 if (errno != 0)
993 warn("exec of install script failed");
994 else
995 warnx("install script returned error status");
996 ret = -1;
997 }
998 free(filename);
999
1000 return ret;
1001}
1002
1003struct find_conflict_data {
1004 const char *pkg;
1005 const char *old_pkg;
1006 const char *pattern;
1007};
1008
1009static int
1010check_explicit_conflict_iter(const char *cur_pkg, void *cookie)
1011{
1012 struct find_conflict_data *data = cookie;
1013
1014 if (data->old_pkg && strcmp(data->old_pkg, cur_pkg) == 0)
1015 return 0;
1016
1017 warnx("Package `%s' conflicts with `%s', and `%s' is installed.",
1018 data->pkg, data->pattern, cur_pkg);
1019
1020 return 1;
1021}
1022
1023static int
1024check_explicit_conflict(struct pkg_task *pkg)
1025{
1026 struct find_conflict_data data;
1027 char *installed, *installed_pattern;
1028 plist_t *p;
1029 int status;
1030
1031 status = 0;
1032
1033 for (p = pkg->plist.head; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
1034 if (p->type == PLIST_IGNORE) {
1035 p = p->next;
1036 continue;
1037 }
1038 if (p->type != PLIST_PKGCFL)
1039 continue;
1040 data.pkg = pkg->pkgname;
1041 data.old_pkg = pkg->other_version;
1042 data.pattern = p->name;
1043 status |= match_installed_pkgs(p->name,
1044 check_explicit_conflict_iter, &data);
1045 }
1046
1047 if (some_installed_package_conflicts_with(pkg->pkgname,
1048 pkg->other_version, &installed, &installed_pattern)) {
1049 warnx("Installed package `%s' conflicts with `%s' when trying to install `%s'.",
1050 installed, installed_pattern, pkg->pkgname);
1051 free(installed);
1052 free(installed_pattern);
1053 status |= -1;
1054 }
1055
1056 return status;
1057}
1058
1059static int
1060check_implicit_conflict(struct pkg_task *pkg)
1061{
1062 plist_t *p;
1063 char *fullpath, *existing;
1064 int status;
1065
1066 if (!pkgdb_open(ReadOnly)) {
1067#if notyet /* XXX empty pkgdb without database? */
1068 warn("Can't open pkgdb for reading");
1069 return -1;
1070#else
1071 return 0;
1072#endif
1073 }
1074
1075 status = 0;
1076
1077 for (p = pkg->plist.head; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
1078 if (p->type == PLIST_IGNORE) {
1079 p = p->next;
1080 continue;
1081 } else if (p->type != PLIST_FILE)
1082 continue;
1083
1084 fullpath = xasprintf("%s/%s", pkg->prefix, p->name);
1085 existing = pkgdb_retrieve(fullpath);
1086 free(fullpath);
1087 if (existing == NULL)
1088 continue;
1089 if (pkg->other_version != NULL &&
1090 strcmp(pkg->other_version, existing) == 0)
1091 continue;
1092
1093 warnx("Conflicting PLIST with %s: %s", existing, p->name);
1094 if (!Force) {
1095 status = -1;
1096 if (!Verbose)
1097 break;
1098 }
1099 }
1100
1101 pkgdb_close();
1102 return status;
1103}
1104
1105static int
1106check_dependencies(struct pkg_task *pkg)
1107{
1108 plist_t *p;
1109 char *best_installed;
1110 int status;
1111 size_t i;
1112
1113 status = 0;
1114
1115 for (p = pkg->plist.head; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
1116 if (p->type == PLIST_IGNORE) {
1117 p = p->next;
1118 continue;
1119 } else if (p->type != PLIST_PKGDEP)
1120 continue;
1121
1122 best_installed = find_best_matching_installed_pkg(p->name);
1123
1124 if (best_installed == NULL) {
1125 /* XXX check cyclic dependencies? */
1126 if (Fake || NoRecord) {
1127 if (!Force) {
1128 warnx("Missing dependency %s\n",
1129 p->name);
1130 status = -1;
1131 break;
1132 }
1133 warnx("Missing dependency %s, continuing",
1134 p->name);
1135 continue;
1136 }
1137 if (pkg_do(p->name, 1, 0)) {
1138 if (ForceDepends) {
1139 warnx("Can't install dependency %s, "
1140 "continuing", p->name);
1141 continue;
1142 } else {
1143 warnx("Can't install dependency %s",
1144 p->name);
1145 status = -1;
1146 break;
1147 }
1148 }
1149 best_installed = find_best_matching_installed_pkg(p->name);
1150 if (best_installed == NULL && ForceDepends) {
1151 warnx("Missing dependency %s ignored", p->name);
1152 continue;
1153 } else if (best_installed == NULL) {
1154 warnx("Just installed dependency %s disappeared", p->name);
1155 status = -1;
1156 break;
1157 }
1158 }
1159 for (i = 0; i < pkg->dep_length; ++i) {
1160 if (strcmp(best_installed, pkg->dependencies[i]) == 0)
1161 break;
1162 }
1163 if (i < pkg->dep_length) {
1164 /* Already used as dependency, so skip it. */
1165 free(best_installed);
1166 continue;
1167 }
1168 if (pkg->dep_length + 1 >= pkg->dep_allocated) {
1169 char **tmp;
1170 pkg->dep_allocated = 2 * pkg->dep_allocated + 1;
1171 pkg->dependencies = xrealloc(pkg->dependencies,
1172 pkg->dep_allocated * sizeof(*tmp));
1173 }
1174 pkg->dependencies[pkg->dep_length++] = best_installed;
1175 }
1176
1177 return status;
1178}
1179
1180static int
1181preserve_meta_data_file(struct pkg_task *pkg, const char *name)
1182{
1183 char *old_file, *new_file;
1184 int rv;
1185
1186 if (Fake)
1187 return 0;
1188
1189 old_file = pkgdb_pkg_file(pkg->other_version, name);
1190 new_file = xasprintf("%s/%s", pkg->install_logdir, name);
1191 rv = 0;
1192 if (rename(old_file, new_file) == -1 && errno != ENOENT) {
1193 warn("Can't move %s from %s to %s", name, old_file, new_file);
1194 rv = -1;
1195 }
1196 free(old_file);
1197 free(new_file);
1198 return rv;
1199}
1200
1201static int
1202start_replacing(struct pkg_task *pkg)
1203{
1204 if (preserve_meta_data_file(pkg, REQUIRED_BY_FNAME))
1205 return -1;
1206
1207 if (preserve_meta_data_file(pkg, PRESERVE_FNAME))
1208 return -1;
1209
1210 if (pkg->meta_data.meta_installed_info == NULL &&
1211 preserve_meta_data_file(pkg, INSTALLED_INFO_FNAME))
1212 return -1;
1213
1214 if (Verbose || Fake) {
1215 printf("%s/pkg_delete -K %s -p %s%s%s '%s'\n",
1216 BINDIR, pkgdb_get_dir(), pkg->prefix,
1217 Destdir ? " -P ": "", Destdir ? Destdir : "",
1218 pkg->other_version);
1219 }
1220 if (!Fake)
1221 fexec_skipempty(BINDIR "/pkg_delete", "-K", pkgdb_get_dir(),
1222 "-p", pkg->prefix,
1223 Destdir ? "-P": "", Destdir ? Destdir : "",
1224 pkg->other_version, NULL);
1225
1226 /* XXX Check return value and do what? */
1227 return 0;
1228}
1229
1230static int check_input(const char *line, size_t len)
1231{
1232 if (line == NULL || len == 0)
1233 return 1;
1234 switch (*line) {
1235 case 'Y':
1236 case 'y':
1237 case 'T':
1238 case 't':
1239 case '1':
1240 return 0;
1241 default:
1242 return 1;
1243 }
1244}
1245
1246static int
1247check_signature(struct pkg_task *pkg, int invalid_sig)
1248{
1249#ifdef BOOTSTRAP
1250 return 0;
1251#else
1252 char *line;
1253 size_t len;
1254
1255 if (strcasecmp(verified_installation, "never") == 0)
1256 return 0;
1257 if (strcasecmp(verified_installation, "always") == 0) {
1258 if (invalid_sig)
1259 warnx("No valid signature found, rejected");
1260 return invalid_sig;
1261 }
1262 if (strcasecmp(verified_installation, "trusted") == 0) {
1263 if (!invalid_sig)
1264 return 0;
1265 fprintf(stderr, "No valid signature found for %s.\n",
1266 pkg->pkgname);
1267 fprintf(stderr,
1268 "Do you want to proceed with the installation [y/n]?\n");
1269 line = fgetln(stdin, &len);
1270 if (check_input(line, len)) {
1271 fprintf(stderr, "Cancelling installation\n");
1272 return 1;
1273 }
1274 return 0;
1275 }
1276 if (strcasecmp(verified_installation, "interactive") == 0) {
1277 fprintf(stderr, "Do you want to proceed with "
1278 "the installation of %s [y/n]?\n", pkg->pkgname);
1279 line = fgetln(stdin, &len);
1280 if (check_input(line, len)) {
1281 fprintf(stderr, "Cancelling installation\n");
1282 return 1;
1283 }
1284 return 0;
1285 }
1286 warnx("Unknown value of configuration variable VERIFIED_INSTALLATION");
1287 return 1;
1288#endif
1289}
1290
1291static int
1292check_vulnerable(struct pkg_task *pkg)
1293{
1294#ifdef BOOTSTRAP
1295 return 0;
1296#else
1297 static struct pkg_vulnerabilities *pv;
1298 int require_check;
1299 char *line;
1300 size_t len;
1301
1302 if (strcasecmp(check_vulnerabilities, "never") == 0)
1303 return 0;
1304 else if (strcasecmp(check_vulnerabilities, "always") == 0)
1305 require_check = 1;
1306 else if (strcasecmp(check_vulnerabilities, "interactive") == 0)
1307 require_check = 0;
1308 else {
1309 warnx("Unknown value of the configuration variable"
1310 "CHECK_VULNERABILITIES");
1311 return 1;
1312 }
1313
1314 if (pv == NULL) {
1315 pv = read_pkg_vulnerabilities_file(pkg_vulnerabilities_file,
1316 require_check, 0);
1317 if (pv == NULL)
1318 return require_check;
1319 }
1320
1321 if (!audit_package(pv, pkg->pkgname, NULL, 0, 2))
1322 return 0;
1323
1324 if (require_check)
1325 return 1;
1326
1327 fprintf(stderr, "Do you want to proceed with the installation of %s"
1328 " [y/n]?\n", pkg->pkgname);
1329 line = fgetln(stdin, &len);
1330 if (check_input(line, len)) {
1331 fprintf(stderr, "Cancelling installation\n");
1332 return 1;
1333 }
1334 return 0;
1335#endif
1336}
1337
1338static int
1339check_license(struct pkg_task *pkg)
1340{
1341#ifdef BOOTSTRAP
1342 return 0;
1343#else
1344 if (LicenseCheck == 0)
1345 return 0;
1346
1347 if ((pkg->buildinfo[BI_LICENSE] == NULL ||
1348 *pkg->buildinfo[BI_LICENSE] == '\0')) {
1349
1350 if (LicenseCheck == 1)
1351 return 0;
1352 warnx("No LICENSE set for package `%s'", pkg->pkgname);
1353 return 1;
1354 }
1355
1356 switch (acceptable_license(pkg->buildinfo[BI_LICENSE])) {
1357 case 0:
1358 warnx("License `%s' of package `%s' is not acceptable",
1359 pkg->buildinfo[BI_LICENSE], pkg->pkgname);
1360 return 1;
1361 case 1:
1362 return 0;
1363 default:
1364 warnx("Invalid LICENSE for package `%s'", pkg->pkgname);
1365 return 1;
1366 }
1367#endif
1368}
1369
1370/*
1371 * Install a single package.
1372 */
1373static int
1374pkg_do(const char *pkgpath, int mark_automatic, int top_level)
1375{
1376 char *archive_name;
1377 int status, invalid_sig;
1378 struct pkg_task *pkg;
1379
1380 pkg = xcalloc(1, sizeof(*pkg));
1381
1382 status = -1;
1383
1384 pkg->archive = find_archive(pkgpath, top_level, &archive_name);
1385 if (pkg->archive == NULL) {
1386 warnx("no pkg found for '%s', sorry.", pkgpath);
1387 goto clean_find_archive;
1388 }
1389
1390#ifndef BOOTSTRAP
1391 invalid_sig = pkg_verify_signature(archive_name, &pkg->archive, &pkg->entry,
1392 &pkg->pkgname);
1393#else
1394 invalid_sig = 0;
1395#endif
1396 free(archive_name);
1397
1398 if (pkg->archive == NULL)
1399 goto clean_memory;
1400
1401 if (read_meta_data(pkg))
1402 goto clean_memory;
1403
1404 /* Parse PLIST early, so that messages can use real package name. */
1405 if (pkg_parse_plist(pkg))
1406 goto clean_memory;
1407
1408 if (check_signature(pkg, invalid_sig))
1409 goto clean_memory;
1410
1411 if (read_buildinfo(pkg))
1412 goto clean_memory;
1413
1414 if (check_pkgtools_version(pkg))
1415 goto clean_memory;
1416
1417 if (check_vulnerable(pkg))
1418 goto clean_memory;
1419
1420 if (check_license(pkg))
1421 goto clean_memory;
1422
1423 if (pkg->meta_data.meta_mtree != NULL)
1424 warnx("mtree specification in pkg `%s' ignored", pkg->pkgname);
1425
1426 pkg->logdir = xasprintf("%s/%s", config_pkg_dbdir, pkg->pkgname);
1427
1428 if (Destdir != NULL)
1429 pkg->install_logdir = xasprintf("%s/%s", Destdir, pkg->logdir);
1430 else
1431 pkg->install_logdir = xstrdup(pkg->logdir);
1432
1433 if (NoRecord && !Fake) {
1434 const char *tmpdir;
1435
1436 tmpdir = getenv("TMPDIR");
1437 if (tmpdir == NULL)
1438 tmpdir = "/tmp";
1439
1440 free(pkg->install_logdir);
1441 pkg->install_logdir = xasprintf("%s/pkg_install.XXXXXX", tmpdir);
1442 /* XXX pkg_add -u... */
1443 if (mkdtemp(pkg->install_logdir) == NULL) {
1444 warn("mkdtemp failed");
1445 goto clean_memory;
1446 }
1447 }
1448
1449 switch (check_already_installed(pkg)) {
1450 case 0:
1451 status = 0;
1452 goto clean_memory;
1453 case 1:
1454 break;
1455 case -1:
1456 goto clean_memory;
1457 }
1458
1459 if (check_platform(pkg))
1460 goto clean_memory;
1461
1462 if (check_other_installed(pkg))
1463 goto clean_memory;
1464
1465 if (check_explicit_conflict(pkg))
1466 goto clean_memory;
1467
1468 if (check_implicit_conflict(pkg))
1469 goto clean_memory;
1470
1471 if (pkg->other_version != NULL) {
1472 /*
1473 * Replacing an existing package.
1474 * Write meta-data, get rid of the old version,
1475 * install/update dependencies and finally extract.
1476 */
1477 if (write_meta_data(pkg))
1478 goto nuke_pkgdb;
1479
1480 if (start_replacing(pkg))
1481 goto nuke_pkgdb;
1482
1483 if (pkg->install_logdir_real) {
1484 rename(pkg->install_logdir, pkg->install_logdir_real);
1485 free(pkg->install_logdir);
1486 pkg->install_logdir = pkg->install_logdir_real;
1487 pkg->install_logdir_real = NULL;
1488 }
1489
1490 if (check_dependencies(pkg))
1491 goto nuke_pkgdb;
1492 } else {
1493 /*
1494 * Normal installation.
1495 * Install/update dependencies first and
1496 * write the current package to disk afterwards.
1497 */
1498 if (check_dependencies(pkg))
1499 goto clean_memory;
1500
1501 if (write_meta_data(pkg))
1502 goto nuke_pkgdb;
1503 }
1504
1505 if (run_install_script(pkg, "PRE-INSTALL"))
1506 goto nuke_pkgdb;
1507
1508 if (extract_files(pkg))
1509 goto nuke_pkg;
1510
1511 if (run_install_script(pkg, "POST-INSTALL"))
1512 goto nuke_pkgdb;
1513
1514 /* XXX keep +INSTALL_INFO for updates? */
1515 /* XXX keep +PRESERVE for updates? */
1516 if (mark_automatic)
1517 mark_as_automatic_installed(pkg->pkgname, 1);
1518
1519 pkg_register_depends(pkg);
1520
1521 if (Verbose)
1522 printf("Package %s registered in %s\n", pkg->pkgname, pkg->install_logdir);
1523
1524 if (pkg->meta_data.meta_display != NULL)
1525 fputs(pkg->meta_data.meta_display, stdout);
1526
1527 status = 0;
1528 goto clean_memory;
1529
1530nuke_pkg:
1531 if (!Fake) {
1532 if (pkg->other_version) {
1533 warnx("Updating of %s to %s failed.",
1534 pkg->other_version, pkg->pkgname);
1535 warnx("Remember to run pkg_admin rebuild-tree after fixing this.");
1536 }
1537 delete_package(FALSE, &pkg->plist, FALSE, Destdir);
1538 }
1539
1540nuke_pkgdb:
1541 if (!Fake) {
1542 (void) remove_files(pkg->install_logdir, "+*");
1543 if (recursive_remove(pkg->install_logdir, 1))
1544 warn("Couldn't remove %s", pkg->install_logdir);
1545 free(pkg->install_logdir_real);
1546 free(pkg->install_logdir);
1547 free(pkg->logdir);
1548 pkg->install_logdir_real = NULL;
1549 pkg->install_logdir = NULL;
1550 pkg->logdir = NULL;
1551 }
1552
1553clean_memory:
1554 if (pkg->logdir != NULL && NoRecord && !Fake) {
1555 if (recursive_remove(pkg->install_logdir, 1))
1556 warn("Couldn't remove %s", pkg->install_logdir);
1557 }
1558 free(pkg->install_prefix);
1559 free(pkg->install_logdir_real);
1560 free(pkg->install_logdir);
1561 free(pkg->logdir);
1562 free_buildinfo(pkg);
1563 free_plist(&pkg->plist);
1564 free_meta_data(pkg);
1565 if (pkg->archive)
1566 archive_read_free(pkg->archive);
1567 free(pkg->other_version);
1568 free(pkg->pkgname);
1569clean_find_archive:
1570 free(pkg);
1571 return status;
1572}
1573
1574int
1575pkg_perform(lpkg_head_t *pkgs)
1576{
1577 int errors = 0;
1578 lpkg_t *lpp;
1579
1580 while ((lpp = TAILQ_FIRST(pkgs)) != NULL) {
1581 if (pkg_do(lpp->lp_name, Automatic, 1))
1582 ++errors;
1583 TAILQ_REMOVE(pkgs, lpp, lp_link);
1584 free_lpkg(lpp);
1585 }
1586
1587 return errors;
1588}
